name: Projectile Motion
latex: x = v_0\cos\theta \cdot t, \quad y = v_0\sin\theta \cdot t - \frac{1}{2}gt^2, \quad R = \frac{v_0^2\sin(2\theta)}{g}
explanation: Projectile motion combines horizontal (constant velocity) and vertical (constant acceleration) motion. Horizontal: x = v₀cos θ × t. Vertical: y = v₀sin θ × t - ½gt². Range (maximum horizontal distance): R = v₀²sin(2θ)/g. Maximum range at 45° angle. Used in ballistics, sports, and understanding two-dimensional motion.

examples.problem: Projectile launched at 30 m/s, 45° angle. What is range? (g = 9.8 m/s²)
